name: San Antonio Missions National Historical Park
description: Welcome to San Antonio Missions, a National Park Service site and the only UNESCO World Heritage Site in Texas. Each mission in the park is a center of community and has been since the early 1700s. They changed life in this region, introducing new technologies while enforcing new cultural guidelines. As you visit, reflect on change, culture, power, and how people have used the land.
shortDescription: Welcome to San Antonio Missions, a National Park Service site and the only UNESCO World Heritage Site in Texas. Each mission in the park is a center of community and has been since the early 1700s. Th...

address.line1: Visitor Center at Mission San José

operatingHours.description:
Park grounds are open sunrise to sunset. Mission San José is open 9am-5pm. 
Our park store located in the Visitor Center is open daily 9 am to 1 pm and 2 pm to 5 pm. 
Park grounds are closed on Thanksgiving Day, Christmas Day, and New Year's Day.

climate.weatherDescription: Over the course of a year, the temperature typically varies from 40°F to 95°F and is rarely below 29°F or above 100°F. The warm season lasts from May through September with an average daily high temperature above 90°F and a low of 75°F. The cold season lasts from November through February with an average daily high below 68°F and an average low of 40°F. The relative humidity ranges from 40-80% over the course of the year, which can be very uncomfortable to many people.

images.title: Mission San Juan
images.altText: White frescoed church with a stone ruin to the left in the foreground.
images.caption: Mission San Juan church and stone ruins.

images.title: Mission Espada, World Heritage Site
images.caption: A part of Mission Espada's ranch is located 30 miles south-east, outside of Floresville, TX.

images.title: Tours of Mission San José
images.altText: Park Ranger leads a tour through Mission San José
images.caption: Catch a tour at Mission San José at 10:00, 11:00, 1:00 and 3:00 daily.

images.title: Rose Window at Mission San Jose
images.altText: Rose window at mission San Jose, with linestone carvings surrounding a small glass window.
images.caption: The Rose Window is a famous feature of Mission San Jose.

images.title: Mission San Jose sunset
images.altText: Mission San Jose church and convento during the golden hour with tree
images.caption: Explore 18th century mission sites like Mission San Jose.

images.title: Mission Concepcion Convento & Church
images.altText: Mission Concepcion convento with church in background.
images.caption: Mission Concepcion is the nation's oldest unrestored stone church.
